Is it necessary to set ignore the trim? How about there is a bug in the plugin?
If the plugin works correct, we should not get trimmed exception. If the plugin doesn't work properly, the working shadow stream can still be trimmed and we get a trim exception, right?

If we don't ignore the trim, we'll get TrimmedExceptions on a new snapshot cycle. At the end of the first snapshot cycle we signal the plugin to resume checkpoint/trim, therefore, by the second cycle, the shadow stream has been trimmed one or several times.
